place.name: SEAVINGTON ST MARY
place.gazetteerText: SEAVINGTON-ST. MARY, a village and a parish in Chard district, Somerset. The village stands 3 miles E of Ilminster r. station; and, with S., St. Michael, has a post-office of the name of Seavington, under Ilminster. The parish includes the tything of S.-Abbott, and comprises 988 acres. Real property, with S., St. Michael, £4, 269. Pop. of S., St. Mary alone, 330. Houses, 76. The manor belongs to N. Welman, Esq. The living is a vicarage, in the diocese of Bath and Wells. Value, £58. Patron, Earl Powlett. The church is early English. There are a Bible Christian chapel, and a parochial school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
